intro: Rhysolepis sodiroi, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling a mist or haze, hence its common name. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine, silky hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Rhysolepis sodiroi is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its vibrant color and unique floral structure.
